name: JenniferAK
body: Crap...as a standalone name I meant John, not Jon. Sorry!

name: GoodbyeToby
body: I always think it's Jon when named Jonathan and John when named just John. I could be completely wrong though, it's just how I know them as.

name: junebug69
body: John is the proper spelling for the official name. Jon, imo, is th nickname for Jonathan. John by far

name: JellyBellyJump
body: I prefer Jon, but I'm biased, it's my dad's name! I agree with other posters, pick the spelling based on who your naming the baby after. I have nearly the same example: my husband has a Uncle John that's passed away and my father has passed away. But our son's middle name is spelled Jon because he's named after my father.

name: StSimcoe
body: I agree with you. Either Jonathan or John.

name: Skilocat
body:
My son's middle name is after his grandfather Ronald. But 'Ronald' never went by that name, he was always called Ronnie. So LO's middle name is just that - Ronnie.
So my vote is Jon :) I feel like it adds a super personal touch and deeper meaning to Everett's name.

name: danceswithdiapers
body: I agree with meg. I think with the spelling John you can say it honors both sides. definitely how would spell it. good luck.

name: nikkidubai
body: Agree john is a full name but Jon is a nn for Jonathan. But honestly either way you are fine to tell them all you've named the baby Jon/john after them. Is there a reason naming baby after brother? It's usually grandparents so I would sway that way (plus John is better) unless your husband has a strong reason to be after his brother.

name: babyk-o
body: Thanks for all of your help. Still not 100% sure what I'm going to do. Is Jon a legit spelling or is it a nickname/short form for Jonathan? Thank you!

name: GirlMom1234
body: John. Jon is a nickname, as you mentioned.
